comment: Explained physics material better than my lecture professor. She was lenient when people forgot lab manuals and helped with the labs to ensure we understood them and could complete them properly. Grade-A professor who obviously cares.

If you take this be sure to pay attention during class. If you struggle go to office hours. She is incredibly willing to help with anything. homework is very hard but again she is willing to go over it with you, and was only 8-12 questions a week. And the extra credit in this class was phenomenal. Far better than the rest of the terrible phys dept.
Good lab professor. Everything was clearly explained at the beginning of class and she was very clear on how things were to be graded. Nearly had a perfect score it was so easy.

She is super nice, her exams are harder compared to other professors but everything on them was in the lecture, breakout session, or the Homework. If you study hard you can get an A. Drops lowest exam, curved one, Test corrections for 2, gave bonus credit for breakout session participation. Physics is hard but you can get an A if you study. Lock in
Honestly her Lab was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken, show up and you will get an A. 11 labs total, drops lowest one. Very easy lab and she is chill.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: She's passionate about physics, for sure. Her way of teaching? Terrible. Exams were inconsistent, study guides aren't helpful, disorganized with slideshows AND time management. I'll give her points for providing extra credit though. Overall, don't take her lecture course.
Super easy lab and drops 1 lab grade

I didn't like her as a professor, but she is very sweet. Breakout sessions were extra credit, which saved my grade, final is worth 25% of grade. I bombed every exam but still managed a C, she's a queen for that, she definitely rounded up for me. The tests were insanely difficult and hard to understand, so beware.

Her lectures sucked, honestly. She's not engaging as a professor and she made physics 1 way harder than it should've been. After every test, people in the class groupme would say how terrible and unprepared they were. However, I took her in lab and did great in there since she's not really teaching you anything and she grades labs super leniently.

Not a good professor; the exams are a lot harder than any assignment. The study guides are not helpful, as they are significantly watered down. The exams are worded very poorly. 
The class was very fast-paced. She also consistently makes errors when doing examples. 
Overall, not a good professor; her rating is only high because her labs are easy.

The lab itself was a little difficult to follow because it was way ahead of the lecture, but she did an amazing job simplifying everything so it was easy to understand. I've also never dealt with circuits before, so that was very confusing, but she helped explain it and showed me how to set them up. You can tell she cares about your learning!

Very difficult class, but the professor is nice. Homework is mainly due on Saturday nights which i do not like, and test can be rewordered way differently from the homework, and the lecture slides. Textbook was provided for free.

Physics 1 Lab is a super easy class if you show up and pay attention to Dr Behera's intro lectures. She's super nice and understanding, and lets you submit your lab reports either online or in person. Highly recommend!

She was incredibly nice and great at explaining what we would be doing each Physics Lab. She would help us if we were confused about something and help point out if we were doing something wrong. She was just a great professor all around and highly recommend any student to take her class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment:
Very great professor with clear instruction before each lab
Attendance only mandatory as it's a lab and all labs require attendance

The professor is sweet and caring for the students in this class. Attendance is mandatory for the lab but all the work can be done during the class itself. She is lax in her grading because there are actual measurements made in the class and can have a marginal error.
She is really kind and knowledgeable. The syllabus was similar to Physics 1 Lab, no quizzes, tests, or final. Would recommend.

Dr. Behera is a wonderful professor, I took 2212L (Physics 2 lab) and it was the most straightforward. 

Attend the labs, do the lab reports, get an A. Very fair grader, labs were easy to follow and very helpful compared to the lecture. 

I can't recommend her enough!

Dr. Behera genuinely cares about her students & wants to see them succeed. She was very lenient. I personally had to put in the work to understand the concepts, but she provided a lot of extra credit that was added to the homework. She went from doing 3 exams to 4. Final was relatively easy and short. Also has weekly quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Pretty easy lab. Grade is based on 10 labs with no quizzes or finals. The labs were not difficult and the TA knew what she was doing. One of the easiest labs i've ever taken.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.
